SEARCH
Module brickGame
Package com.brickbreakergame.menus

Class PauseMenu

java.lang.Object
com.brickbreakergame.menus.PauseMenu
public class PauseMenu extends Object
Represents the in-game pause menu for the Brick Breaker game. This class is responsible for managing the pause menu interface, providing players with various options during gameplay interruption. The menu offers functionalities such as resuming the game, saving progress, loading a saved game, restarting the current game, or quitting the game entirely. Additionally, the pause menu allows players to access and modify sound settings.

  • Method Details

    • display

      public static void display(Main main, GameEngine engine, javafx.stage.Stage primaryStage)
      Displays the pause menu with options for resuming the game, managing sound settings, saving, loading, restarting, and quitting.
      Parameters:
      main - The Main instance associated with the game.
      engine - The GameEngine instance controlling the game.
      primaryStage - The primary stage of the game.

    • initializePauseMenuBlur

      public static void initializePauseMenuBlur(javafx.stage.Stage primaryStage)
      Initializes a Gaussian blur effect on the primary stage's scene. Applies a visual blur effect to the game window when the pause menu is displayed.
      Parameters:
      primaryStage - The primary stage of the game.

    • disablePauseMenuBlur

      public static void disablePauseMenuBlur(javafx.stage.Stage primaryStage)
      Disables the Gaussian blur effect on the primary stage's scene. Removes the blur effect from the game window when the pause menu is closed.
      Parameters:
      primaryStage - The primary stage of the game.

    • soundMenuOpen

      protected static void soundMenuOpen()
      Opens the sound settings menu with a fade-out effect on the pause menu.

    • highlightSoundSystemButton

      public static void highlightSoundSystemButton()
      Highlights the sound system button in the pause menu when the sound system is opened.

    • getPauseLayout

      public static javafx.scene.layout.VBox getPauseLayout()
      Retrieves the VBox layout used in the pause menu. This layout is the container for all UI elements displayed in the pause menu.
      Returns:
      The VBox layout of the pause menu.
